alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Lubbock; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 8:27AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following counties, Crosby, Floyd, Hale, Hockley, Lubbock, Lynn and Terry. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 827 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated a line of strong to severe thunderstorms moving southeast through the area. Intense rainfall rates up to 0.60 inch in 5 minutes has been observed at Abernathy with other gauges showing 1/4 to 1/2 in very short periods of time. heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Brownfield, Slaton, Floydada, Abernathy, Tahoka, Crosbyton, White River Lake, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ralls, Petersburg, Lorenzo, Ransom Canyon, O`Donnell, Kalgary, Woodrow, Downtown Lubbock and Texas Tech University. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
